DOC.brief_summary: This trial randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled , crossover study evaluate effect JZP-110 driving performance subject excessive sleepiness due obstructive sleep apnea .
DOC.brief_title: Study Assessing Effects JZP-110 Driving Performance Treatment Excessive Sleepiness OSA
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female , age 21 65 year inclusive 2 . Diagnosis obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) per ICSD3 3 . BMI 18 < 40 kg/m2 4 . Willing able provide write informed consent 1 . Female subject pregnant , nursing , lactate 2 . Any clinically relevant medical , behavioral , psychiatric disorder OSA associate excessive sleepiness 3 . History presence bipolar disorder , bipolar related disorder , schizophrenia , schizophrenia spectrum disorder , psychotic disorder accord DSM5 criterion 4 . History presence unstable medical condition , behavioral psychiatric disorder ( include active suicidal ideation ) , surgical history could affect safety subject interfere study efficacy and/or safety assessment per judgment investigator 5 . History bariatric surgery within past year history gastric bypass procedure 6 . Presence history significant cardiovascular disease 7 . Unable washout refrain take overthecounter ( OTC ) prescription medication could affect sleepwake function
